description: From Latin ductor, agent noun of duco (“to lead”).

examples: be commanded , as having its ductors or commanders at each angle

entries.meaning: (printing) A device, usually in the form of an oscillating roller, for transferring ink from a source to the ink train rollers in a controlled manner.
examples: The combination, with a fountain-roller and an ink-cylinder, of a ductor movable between said roller and cylinder for delivering ink from one to the other...
